name: 野生動物學
goals: Students will become familiar with fundamental concepts of wildlife biology, as well as practical tools used in wildlife conservation and management.
Students will put the knowledge they learned towards an independent project, which they present in class.
syllabus:
Weeks 1-8: Wildlife biology basics

1.Introduction

2-3. Individual ecology

4-5. Population dynamics

6-7. Species interaction

8\. Climate change and wildlife

Weeks 9-14: Wildlife conservation and management

9.Counting animals

10.Demographic structure

11.Population viability analysis

12.Conservation genetics

13.Meta-population dynamics

14.Wildlife conservation and management in the context of ecosystem

Weeks 15-16: Student project presentation

Weeks 17-18: Independent study

methodologies.note: Each topic will be given a formal lecture.
Homework will be designed to train students in problem solving.
Multimedia will be used during lectures.
Students will conduct an independent project.

grading.note: Several homework assignments will be given throughout the semester.
Students are required to actively participate in class discussion.
Students will choose from a list of given topics to conduct an independent study or mini-review, either individually or as a team.
